logic

Class Ogre

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Character
      • logic.Ogre
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestOgre

    public class Ogre
extends Character
    This class represents a specific type of Character. This specific type is one of the Hero's enemies (currently present in the second level and player created levels). The Ogre has (pseudo)random movement patern.
    Author:
    Jo√£o Vieira, Susana Lima
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ogre

        public Ogre(int newX,
            int newY,
            boolean moveClub)
        Creates an Ogre in preferred x and y values Ogre starts with. This Ogre can be allowed(or not) to move its Weapon. stunned initial value is false and its counter is 0.
        Parameters:
        newX - the location coordinate
        newY - the location coordinate
        moveClub - the flag indicating Weapon movement

        public char getNextMove()
        Generates a (pseudo)random char representing a movement direction in order to update this Ogre position on Map (x and y values).

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(char cOgre,
                           char cClub)
        Takes two char as reference for updating both this Ogre position on Map (x and y values) and its Weapon accordingly to its new position.
        Parameters:
        cOgre - the new Ogre movement corresponding char
        cClub - the new Weapon movement corresponding char
